content: So, to address your question, if you use our first quarter adjusted EBITDA guidance range of $215 million dollars to $220 million as a starting point, and then that guidance includes $20 million to $25 million of performance fee earnings for the fourth quarter -- first quarter that really gets you to a run rate number for management fee EBITDA, which is a pretty good starting point in terms of thinking about the year based on the run rate of where the business stands today.
